title.rendered: Find the Brandon University Admission Requirements 2024

content.rendered:
Brandon University Admission Requirements, Nigeria admission, English proficiency language, Canadian High School Applicants

Brandon University Admission is ongoing for all interested students who want to apply for admission.

Brandon University admission Requirements

Nigeria Admission Requirements:

  • West African Examinations Certificate (WAEC)
  • or General Certificate of Education

English language aptitude assessment scores must come in a conserved envelope from the examination authority, except TOEFL which may also be submitted by e-mail directly through TOEFL (ETS) if chosen.

GCE: applicants must have passed in five different subjects of which at least two subjects must be approved at the basic point;
OR
Passes in four different subjects of which at smallest amount three subjects must be approved at the superior level.

Note that:  Two basic supplementary stage courses may be submitted in of one the higher-level course.  Four Advanced additional Level courses may be submitted in two higher-level courses.

WAEC:  maximum of 5 subjects at C5 or better as well as English and Mathematics. Please obtain a scratch card and send the next information in the body of one email: name, serial/PIN, examination digit, and exam date with year. 

International Baccalaureate: applicants with an International Baccalaureate Diploma within a general score of 24 points are considered to have the equivalent of Manitoba High School Graduation for purposes of access to Brandon University. The IB Diploma must contain at least three Higher Level courses, with the remaining courses being also the Higher Level or the Standard Level

English Proficiency Requirements

The following tests are accepted at Brandon University:

Test Undergraduate Graduate
C1 Advanced
The Cambridge English Advanced exam		 176 Not relevant
C2 Proficiency
The Cambridge Certificate of Proficiency in English		 176 176
CAEL
Canadian Academic English Language Assessment		 60 60
CAEL CE
Canadian Academic English Language Assessment

Due to COVID-19 test center closures, Brandon University will also temporarily accept CAEL Online with the same score as the regular CAEL CE.

 60 60
CanTEST
Canadian Test for English for Scholars and Trainees
  • 4.5 (reading and listening)
  • 4.0 (speaking and writing)
  • 4.5 (reading and listening)
  • 4.0 (speaking and writing)
EAP
English for Academic Purposes at Brandon University
  • Successful completion of Tier 4 for undergraduate students
  • Successful completion of Tier 4 with 75% in each course plus CanTEST minimum scores as described above for Graduate students
IELTS
International English Language Testing System (Academic)

 

Due to COVID-19 test center closures, Brandon University will also temporarily accept the IELTS Indicator Online English Language Test with a minimum score of 7.0

 

  

6.5 overall

 

 

7.0 overall

 

 

 

 

  

6.5 overall

 

 

7.0 overall

 

 
MELAB
Michigan English Language Assessment Battery		 80 80
PTEA
Pearson Test of English Academic		 58 60
TOEFL
Test of English as a Foreign Language

Due to COVID-19 test center closures, Brandon University will also temporarily accept the TOEFL iBT Special Home Edition with the same score as the regular TOEFL iBT.
  • 550 (paper-based test) with a minimum score of 50 in each testing section.
  • 80 (Internet-based test) with a minimum score of 20 in each testing section.
  • 567 (paper-based)
  • 86 (Internet-based)

All credentials submitted must be official. Brandon University will accept credentials that have been sent from the granting institute only.  The only exception is TOEFL which may be sent by e-mail directly through TOEFL (ETS). We will not accept e-mailed, photocopied, notarized or attested documents.

High School Course Equivalencies

Manitoba Ontario Saskatchewan
English 40S English ENG4U ELA A30 and B30
Pre-Calculus Math 40S MCV4U or MCB4U Pre-Cal 30 or Cal 30
Applied Math 40S Math Adv Function Math 30 (Foundations)
Physics 40S Physics SPH4U Physics 30
Chemistry 40S Chemistry SCH4U Chemistry 30
Biology 40S Biology SBI4U Biology 30

 

Admission Requirements – Canadian High School Applicants

Province / Territory Admission Requirements
Manitoba High School graduation with no M, I, or E designate courses or a provincially recognized G.E.D.
Alberta; Northwest Territories; Maya Scotia; Nunavut; Prince Edward Island High School graduation with a minimum average of 60% on five Grade 12 subjects as well as English.
British Columbia; Yukon High School graduation with a maximum average of 60%, together with English 12 or English First Peoples 12, and 3 other subjects.
New Brunswick High School graduation with a bare minimum average of 60% on six subjects including English.
Newfoundland High School graduation with a least amount general average of 60% percent on ten credits as well as English.
Ontario High School graduation with a maximum of 60% average on six Grade 12 U/M courses including English.
Quebec The first-year CEGEP with an in the general standard of 60% on at least 12 academic, or Grade 12 standing from a Quebec Department of Education recognized private school.
Saskatchewan High School graduation with a bare minimum standard of 60% on 5 subjects at the 30 level as well as English 30A and 30B.
